column4: i use conky. but this code : ${downspeed eth0} is not working for wireles. can we add another clock for wireles and if possible for other connections types ? . thanks!
for wireless you would need the wirless interface.. most likely wlan0
i try it but is not working on conky :(
yes it does seem downspeed/upspeed has depreciated.
what does conky display when you use that?
i have a small graph and a numeric value for down and up speed seperated...
i understand that. what i'm asking is what does conky display when you use ${downspeedf wlan0}? is it blank output on conky or does it show an error?
there is a #conky if i'm unhelpful :)
${downspeed downspeedf} is incorrect. replace it with ${downspeedf eth0} or with wlan0  ..which ever interface you're trying to use.
and the same with upspeed replace it with upspeedf
dont look for first line. i m trying it now...
i assume with your lack of further response that solved it issue?
conky chanlle solved it. my connection is eth1. but we dont know why ?
ahh, excellent. finding the right interface is always good :)
